alert.note: Alert for Hampshire (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 25 at 12:23PM EDT until September 25 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...WEST CENTRAL JEFFERSON...SOUTHWESTERN MORGAN...SOUTHERN BERKELEY COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA AND EAST CENTRAL HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA... At 1222 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenwood, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Martinsburg, Greenwood, Inwood, Winebrenners Cross, Glengary, Shanghai, Gerrardstown, Vanville, Ridgeway, Bunker Hill, Bloomery, Arden, Largent, Valley High, Unger, Martinsburg Airport and Ridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
